titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the United States Presidents Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:09

did.unittitle: United States presidents collection

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Letters, legal documents, and other material created or signed by United States presidents.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ongoing collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. Type of accession (gift or purchase) and date of acquisition is noted in the box-and-folder list. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The United States Presidents Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: United States Presidents Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Restricted Fragile Papers in portfolio may only be consulted with permission of the appropriate curator. Preservation photocopies for reference use have been substituted in the main files.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from previously existing cards in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. If the collection also contains unlisted or unsorted material, it has been noted in the box-and-folder list. This finding aid will be updated periodically to account for new materials that may be added to the collection. The date of the most recent update is noted on the title page. For information on material that may have been added since the last update, please consult the Public Service Desk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This finding aid encompasses accessions of single manuscripts and small groups of manuscripts and other papers, by or pertaining to United States Presidents, which the library has chosen to group and list as an artificial collection.

did.unittitle: File List
Adams, John
Letters-patent appointing Joseph Hopkinson Indian comissioner for the Oneida Tribe, Philadelphia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also signed by Timothy Pickering. Accompanied by engraved portrait of Adams. Gift, 1957.

did.unittitle: Receipt in Adams' hand stating that he has given to William Walters 33 guilders and five stuyvers, Amsterdam

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Receipt is signed by William Walters. A note on the verso identifies Walters as "a seaman prisoner escaped from England and taken with the Small Pox here at Amsterdam." Gift, 1958.

did.unittitle: ALS to William F. Vilas, Chairman, D. P. Bestor, and other members of the Committee of the Democratic National Convention, Albany

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This letter, accepting the nomination for President by the Democratic party, was written by Cleveland in the Adirondacks, and sent to Daniel S. Lamont to be copied and transmitted officially to the Democratic party committee. Gift, 1937.

did.unittitle: Brief for the Supreme Court case of Andrew Spaulding and another versus Albert B. Williams and others, [Buffalo, N.Y.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Autograph manuscript. Accompanied by: typed sheet giving additional facts concerning the case of Spaulding versus Williams, with George A. Bailey's name stamp; ALS from Judge Charles Barker Wheeler to George A. Bailey, Buffalo, 1915 Jun 9; 3 newspaper clippings concerning manuscript briefs of Cleveland. Gift, 1919.

did.unittitle: Signature, on Executive Mansion stationery, made at Washington shortly after his marriage

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.p: Gift, 1956.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gift, 1935.

did.unittitle: Coolidge, Calvin
TLS to the Rainbow Division Veterans Association, Washington

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by 2 TLS from Bentley Mulford to the editor of the Saturday Review and to Andrew Keogh, concerning the letter from Coolidge. Gift, 1925.

did.unittitle: Holograph letter to William Howard Taft

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With a note of transmittal from Taft to Anson Phelps Stokes, on verso, 1927 Apr 12. Gift, 1927.

did.unittitle: Receipt book of the Continental Congress

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pages 1049 and 1050, with items receipted by the following persons: John Taylor Griffin, Richard Kenney, Edward Carroll, Thomas Clements, Thomas Jefferson, George Thompson, William Duval, B. Dandridge, John Stratton, John Wilson, William Turner, Robert Anderson and Fortunatus [Tyd--?]. Gift, 1933.

did.unittitle: Ship's passport issued to Thomas Ward, master of the brig Laura

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed form in two languages, with names and dates supplied in manuscript. Signed by Jefferson and countersigned by Ab. Bishop, Collector of the Customs, New Haven. Gift, 1933.

"Journal" of the Federal Convention of 1787

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript copy in the hand of Madison of the "Journal" made by William Jackson as Secretary of the Convention. Gift, 1926.

did.unittitle: Address of the President, United Nations Flag Day, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With corrections by FDR. Signed: "For Yale University Library. This is the 1st carbon copy of the original from which I read. Franklin D. Roosevelt." Accompanied by a TLS from Grace G. Tully to Emily Hardy Hall, forwarding the manuscript, 1942 Jun 16.

did.unittitle: Restricted Fragile Papers

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Reference surrogates have been substituted in the main files. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
